title: Business Talent (Permanent) visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Business Talent (Permanent) visa (subclass 132), which allowed individuals to establish or develop a business in Australia. It includes eligibility requirements, details for two visa streams, costs, processing time guidance, and important closure and refund notes.

status.refund_information: Applicants for Significant Business History or Venture Capital Entrepreneur stream may be entitled to a refund if they withdrew their application on or after 31 July 2024.

structured_data.description: This visa allows you to establish a new or develop an existing business in Australia.
basic_eligibility: be nominated by an Australian state or territory government agency
be invited to apply for the visa
have the required funding or assets

streams.description: For experienced business owners to operate a new or existing business in Australia.

requirements.annual_business_turnover: at least AUD 3 million for at least 2 of the 4 fiscal years immediately before invitation
requirements.total_net_assets_in_businesses: at least AUD 400,000 as ownership interest in one or more qualifying businesses for at least 2 of the 4 fiscal years immediately before invitation

streams.processing_time_note: Processing times available using the visa processing time guide tool; indicative only and not specific to individual applications.

streams.description: For people who have sourced venture capital funding from a member of the Australian Investment Council (AIC), formerly Australian Private Equity and Venture Capital Association Limited (AVCAL).

requirements.venture_capital_funding: at least AUD 1 million from an Australian venture capital firm

streams.processing_time_note: Processing times available using the visa processing time guide tool; indicative only and not specific to individual applications.
